definitions: To perpetrate or carry out (a mistake, crime, or immoral act).
To pledge or bind (a person or an organization) to a certain course or policy.
To send (a person) to prison, a mental hospital, or another institution.
To dedicate (money, time, or oneself) to a particular task or purpose.
To express or present (an idea, policy, etc.) officially for consideration or approval.
examples: He was sent to prison for committing a crime.
The company committed to reducing its carbon footprint.
She was committed to a psychiatric hospital.
They committed their resources to the project.
The government committed to a new environmental policy.
